Definition: Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia is a type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, characterized by the overproduction of a specific type of antibody.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic mutations.
Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, and symptoms related to high levels of antibodies.
Diagnosis: Blood tests, bone marrow biopsy, and imaging studies.

Definition: West Nile virus is a viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes that can cause neurological disease.
Causes: Infection from the West Nile virus, primarily through mosquito bites.
Symptoms: Fever, headache, body aches, and in severe cases, neurological symptoms.
Treatment: Supportive care; no specific antiviral treatment.

Definition: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome is a condition characterized by an extra electrical pathway in the heart, leading to episodes of rapid heart rate.
Treatment: Medications, catheter ablation, and lifestyle modifications.

Definition: Wrist pain is discomfort in the wrist area that can result from various causes.
Causes: Injury, arthritis, repetitive strain, and carpal tunnel syndrome.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, and limited range of motion.
Treatment: Rest, ice, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery.
